org.jamesframework.core.search.listeners

Interface NeighbourhoodSearchListener<SolutionType extends Solution>

  • Type Parameters:
    SolutionType - solution type of the search to which the listener may be attached, required to extend Solution
    All Superinterfaces:
    SearchListener<SolutionType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmptyNeighbourhoodSearchListener

    public interface NeighbourhoodSearchListener<SolutionType extends Solution>
extends SearchListener<SolutionType>
    Extends the general search listener interface with a neighbourhood search specific callback, fired when the current solution has been modified. A listener implementing this interface may still be attached to a general search, in which case the specific callback will never be fired. If attached to a neighbourhood search, it will be fired whenever a new current solution has been adopted, in addition to the general callbacks from SearchListener.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void modifiedCurrentSolution(NeighbourhoodSearch<? extends SolutionType> search, SolutionType newCurrentSolution, double newCurrentSolutionEvaluation)
      Fired whenever a new current solution has been adopted.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jamesframework.core.search.listeners.SearchListener

        newBestSolution, searchStarted, searchStopped, stepCompleted

    • Method Detail

      • modifiedCurrentSolution

        void modifiedCurrentSolution(NeighbourhoodSearch<? extends SolutionType> search,
                           SolutionType newCurrentSolution,
                           double newCurrentSolutionEvaluation)
        Fired whenever a new current solution has been adopted. Called exactly once for every modification to the current solution.
        Parameters:
        search - neighbourhood search which updated its current solution
        newCurrentSolution - newly adopted current solution
        newCurrentSolutionEvaluation - corresponding evaluation
        Throws:
        IncompatibleSearchListenerException - if the listener is not compatible with the search
